wikipedia_page.main: Walter Drawbridge Crick (15 Dec. 1857, Hanslope – 23 Dec. 1903) was an English businessman, amateur geologist and palaeontologist.  He published with Charles Darwin.  He was the grandfather (by his son Harry) of Francis Crick, the molecular geneticist.Born at Pinion End Farm, Hanslope, Crick went into business as a shoemaker, founding a company based at St Giles Street, Northampton that was inherited by his son Walter.
